abstract.p: Merrill Lynch HSBC in London, joint venture of Merrill Lynch & Co and HSBC Holdings, names Lowe Pintas & Partners Worldwide to handle its advertising account; billings for next 12 to 18 months are estimated at $100 million (Advertising column) (S)

block.p: Merrill Lynch HSBC in London, the joint venture of Merrill Lynch & Company and HSBC Holdings, said yesterday that it had named Lowe Lintas & Partners Worldwide, part of the Lowe Group unit of the Interpublic Group of Companies, to handle its account.
Billings for the next 12 to 18 months were estimated at $100 million to introduce the global online banking and investment service aimed at affluent investors.

Merrill Lynch HSBC in London, the joint venture of Merrill Lynch & Company and HSBC Holdings, said yesterday that it had named Lowe Lintas & Partners Worldwide, part of the Lowe Group unit of the Interpublic Group of Companies, to handle its account.
Billings for the next 12 to 18 months were estimated at $100 million to introduce the global online banking and investment service aimed at affluent investors.

The decision came after a two-month review that had been narrowed to Lowe Lintas and the London offices of Bates Worldwide, a unit of the Cordiant Communications Group, and J. Walter Thompson, part of the WPP Group. The Lowe Lintas London office will lead the work on the account, to create campaigns for the joint venture service.
The service is to be introduced in Britain in the fall, followed by Australia, Canada, Germany, Japan and then other countries.
